text:
We tried the Claypot Bak Kut Teh original, )($7.50), Claypot Meatball Soup ($7.50), and Claypot Braised Pig‚Äôs Trotter ($6.50), along with youtiao and braised egg. My favorite was the BKT and the braised pig‚Äôs trotter, which is rich in natural collagen üòç. It‚Äôs cooked to perfection, making the meat tender and melt-in-your-mouth. The flavorful sauce seeps into the meat, and the gelatinous skin texture was absolutely amazing. Perfect for pairing with rice or noodles!

The prices are reasonable, and the portions are generous, making it a satisfying meal overall.
Very nice herbal style bkt. Meat is also tender and you can add on mushroom or Tau Kee in the soup. Service is orderly with buzzer system and your order is ready in less than 10mins.

Very nice tasting herbal bak kut teh. Ordered liver mee sua, kidney mee sua, and bak kut teh original. Liver and kidneys were tender and not overcooked which I liked. The mee sua had a floury taste to it which I didn‚Äôt like but other than that everything was nice!

Delighted to found out my hometown‚Äôs taste of Bak Kut Teh! With herbal soup. I love their pork ribs and also braised‚Äôs pig trotter. Very tendering and tummy. Plain Mee Sua soup also nice. Side dishes so cheap but big portion given. Much appropriated. Highly recommended üëçüèª
Love their herbal bkt that even my daughter loves it! Their Braised Pork Belly is super shiok! Must Try!. Guess I'm too greedy and packed my order w too many other add on. Simply shiok la! Try them!
